title: The love child of Sweet Square & Durandal Flat??? o\_o
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910im_/http:/typophile.com/files/green_lantern_-_teaser_poster_font_-_1a-(already_on_wtf)_3812.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910im_/http:/typophile.com/files/green_lantern_-_teaser_poster_font_-_2a_6563.png)

Hi All!

This font is from a series of four teaser posters for the Green Lantern movie (2011), designed by Concept Arts.

[FULL POSTERS HERE](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910/http:/www.impawards.com/2011/green_lantern.html)

Is it just a customised version of "MVB Sweet Square"? The I, E, & K seem quite different. I've found a bunch of similar fonts ("Aerotype Durandal Flat", "Piranha" by Nathan Caldecott, "Identikal Rally", "Identikal Rebirth", "FF Aircraft"), but no exact matches.

Also, how would one classify this font? A "chamfered angular square sans-serif"?

\*\*\* Bonus points if anyone can confirm whether the "2011" on the poster is even in the same font? \*\*\*

Thanks in advance! :D

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [green\_lantern\_-\_teaser\_poster\_font\_-\_1a-(already\_on\_wtf).png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910/http:/typophile.com/files/green_lantern_-_teaser_poster_font_-_1a-(already_on_wtf).png) | 45.22 KB |
| [green\_lantern\_-\_teaser\_poster\_font\_-\_2a.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910/http:/typophile.com/files/green_lantern_-_teaser_poster_font_-_2a.png) | 25.01 KB |
author: SethFromNZ

comments.content: What I can say is I was not able to identify it either. It also remains unsolved on [WhatTheFont Forum](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/?q=lantern). So, 2 possibilities: totally hand-drawn from scratch or customization from an existing typeface (what I prefer, less frustrating ;). Sweet Square is also the closest I've found but some details you've already spotted remain off (but not hard to reproduce). It also shares many similarities with [United](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910/http:/typophile.com/wiki/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection), [KP Duty](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/kp-duty) and [Full Block](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819020910/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/fullblock.php) but none of these ones are matching either.

I'll send over somebody I know who might know.

hhp

Unfortunately Hrant, I worked on a different comic book movie than this one. My completely uninformed guess would be that they took an existing font (like Durandal Flat) and modified it for the movie. But since I didn't work on that one, I can't say for certain. Sorry, wish I could be more help.

Thanks Hrant! Thanks Corey! :)

It's nice to know everyone else is as stumped as me. ;)
